intro: Torilis setifolia, commonly known as slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its small white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the seeds are dispersed by wind. The plant contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
